ReferenceDocuments.name: LBSTAT
ReferenceDocuments.description: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTMIG variable LBSTAT. If the CDASH variable LBPERF = "N", the value of LBSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If LBPERF = "Y", LBSTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables ( e.g., LBCAT and LBSCAT, LBTPT ) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable LBTESTCD would be populated as LBALL and an appropriate test name (LBTEST) provided. See SDTMIG Section 4.1.5.1.2.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDASH Implementation Notes
ReferenceDocuments.description: This may be implemented for an Lab entire panel, or on a specific lab test basis. General prompt question to be used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing.
